title: Build Your Own SQLite
description: Learn about SQL syntax, SQLite's file format, B-trees, and more.
overview: This guide takes you through the process of building a basic version of SQLite, one of the most widely used database engines. You'll explore SQL syntax, understand SQLite's file format, dive into the mechanics of B-trees, and learn how data is stored and queried efficiently. By the end of the project, you will have implemented key features of a simple database engine.

sections.title: Introduction to SQLite and Databases
sections.firstMessage:
This section introduces you to SQLite and its fundamental concepts. Here's what you'll learn:
1. Overview of databases and SQLite
2. Introduction to SQL syntax
3. How SQLite works internally

sections.title: Exploring SQLite's File Format
sections.firstMessage:
In this section, we'll dive into the structure of SQLite's database file. Lessons include:
1. The SQLite file format
2. Pages, headers, and schema representation
3. Storing data in SQLite

sections.title: Understanding B-Trees
sections.firstMessage:
Learn how SQLite organizes and queries data efficiently using B-trees. Lessons include:
1. Basics of B-trees
2. Implementing B-tree nodes
3. Querying with B-trees

sections.title: Building a Minimal SQLite Clone
sections.firstMessage:
This section combines everything you've learned to build a simple SQLite clone. Lessons:
1. Parsing SQL commands
2. Managing a database file
3. Executing queries and returning results
